Requirement: The system shall allow users to send, receive, and delete e-mail and attachments.
The system shall allow users to reply to e-mail and attachments.
The system shall allow users to forward e-mail and attachments.
The system shall allow users to print e-mail messages.
The system shall allow users to customize e-mail messages using word processor-like formatting features.
The system shall allow users to establish rules, including auto reply, out of office reply, temporary transfer, and moving files to inbox folders.
The system shall provide spell check functionality for users.
The system shall allow users to organize content into personal folders or similar storage mechanisms for e-mail retrieval.
The system shall allow agency administrators to migrate existing public folders into the statewide e-mail system.
The system shall allow agency administrators to create and manage public folders or similar storage mechanisms for sharing information within their agency or organization.
The system shall allow users to create contact lists, including importing contacts from other sources.
The system shall allow users to export contact lists.
The system shall allow users to share contact lists and the address book.
The system shall allow agency administrators to create and share distribution lists, including query-based lists from LDAP-like directory services.
The system shall allow users to create calendars and customize calendar views.
The system shall allow users to schedule resources, such as conference rooms and teleconference rooms.
The system shall allow users to create reminders and tasks.
The system shall allow agency administrators to accommodate programmer testing of e-mail functionality embedded in software applications.
The system shall allow users to share their inbox, calendar, and files with other users, given appropriate permissions.
The system shall allow users to delegate their permissions to another user.
The system shall allow users to embed links to files and websites in e-mails.
The system shall allow agency administrators to provision e-mail accounts for their organization, including integrating provisioning with LDAP-like directory services.
The system shall allow users to search for e-mails based on age, size, sender, recipient, subject, key word, and attachment content.
The system shall allow agency administrators to auto-enforce standard conventions for creating accounts and distribution lists.
The system shall allow data center administrators to control inbound and outbound message size limits for e-mail.
The system shall allow agency administrators to create generic email accounts/addresses accessible by multiple users.
The system shall allow users to customize their client application view, including adding fields, arranging fields, and ordering emails by fields.
The system shall allow users to archive data at the desktop.
The system shall provide a server-based archiving solution manageable by agency administrators.
The system shall allow agency administrators to archive data at various regularly defined intervals.
The system shall allow agency administrators to search the archive and perform bulk operations (forward, print, restore) on archived items.
The system shall allow agency administrators to filter the archive by sender, recipient, date, subject, content, attachments, and keyword.
The system shall provide long-term retention capabilities separate from the active e-mail system.
The system shall allow individual users to search their portion of the archive repository.
The system shall support meeting Federal regulations for retention (e.g., Sarbanes Oxley, GLB, HIPAA).
The system shall allow agency administrators to satisfy legal requests for e-mail discovery and provide results in printed or digital format.
The system shall capture all e-mails sent and received within the organization.
The system shall allow agency administrators to select specific e-mail retention periods (e.g., 1, 3, or 5 years).
The system shall allow agency administrators to search the e-mail header (Date, From, Subject, To, CC).
The system shall allow agency administrators to search the e-mail body, including the header and all contained text.
The system shall allow agency administrators to perform a "full text" search, including the header, body, and attachments.
The system shall support litigation requests by producing responsive e-mail to a specified location for reading and redaction.
The system shall allow agency administrators to move older data to tiered (lower cost) storage while maintaining accessibility.
The system shall allow agency administrators to import data from sources like PST and NSF files into the archiving solution.
The system shall allow agency administrators to put discovery search results on legal hold to suspend deletion.
The system shall allow users (Legal, OIG, etc.) to review and mark discovery search results.
The system shall allow agency administrators to search using Boolean fields.
The system shall allow agency administrators to archive based on policy (e.g., e-mail address, OU, group, organization).
The system shall allow users to delete, or flag for deletion by system administrators, e-mails that have met their retention period.
The system shall allow users to flag individual e-mails to prevent archiving.
The system shall allow data center administrators to recover data at the file level.
The system shall allow data center administrators to recover all messages.
The system shall allow data center administrators to recover a specific e-mail message.
The system shall allow data center administrators to recover data by mailbox.
The system shall allow data center administrators to recover data by time stamp.
The system shall maintain backup and restore event logs for data center administrators.
The system shall allow data center administrators to restore previous backups without service interruption.
The system shall provide pre-emptive e-mail virus protection (scanning prior to delivery at the mail server).
The system shall provide pre-emptive e-mail content filtering.
The system shall allow data center administrators to whitelist/blacklist senders by domain or IP address.
The system shall allow data center administrators to block or allow e-mail based on multiple message attributes.
The system shall integrate message hygiene (antispam/antivirus) with LDAP.
The system shall provide message hygiene (antispam/antivirus) statistical reports.
The system shall allow users to encrypt outbound e-mail.
The system shall allow users to establish TLS encryption with other businesses or customers.
The system shall protect the reputation of outbound mail gateways.
The system shall protect internal e-mail customer identity.
The system shall allow users to access e-mail, calendar, and address book, and send/receive via secure web or client access.
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Basic Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow users to access e-mail using BlackBerry devices and services.
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Basic Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow users to access e-mail with non-BlackBerry mobile data devices (e.g., iPhones, Treos, Pres).
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Basic Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow agency administrators to support other mobile device protocols (e.g., ActiveSync).
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Basic Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow agency administrators to Create, Update, and Delete BlackBerry accounts.
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Basic Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow users to access their mailbox and components via a web browser over a secure (encrypted) connection.
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Basic Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow users to send/receive e-mails within workflow applications.
The system shall provide resource reservations integrated into e-mail.
The system shall allow users to access an SMTP bridgehead for agency applications.
The system shall allow users to integrate agency applications into the e-mail and mobile messaging environments.
The system shall allow users to manually archive data to the server from their client.
The system shall allow agency administrators to electronically redact information from archival storage.
The system shall allow agency administrators to digitally certify search results.
The system shall allow agency administrators to catalog responsive e-mail by case for electronic certification of complete production.
The system shall allow agency administrators to maintain markings for privileged and non-responsive search results for due diligence.
The system shall provide a full audit trail of discovery and review activities.
The system shall allow data center administrators to perform real-time replication to an alternate site.
The system shall allow data center administrators to perform near-time replication to an alternate site.
The system shall allow data center administrators to fail-over the mail system and clients to an alternate site.
The system shall allow data center administrators to retrieve quarantined messages.
The system shall allow data center administrators to add digital signatures to e-mail.
The system shall allow users to access the e-mail archive remotely.
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Extended Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall allow users to utilize wireless service with GIS integration.
Description: Remote Access, Mobile Messaging (Extended Functional Requirement)

Requirement: The system shall provide fax service integrated into e-mail.
The system shall allow users to integrate telephone messaging (VOIP) into e-mail and vice versa.
The system shall provide a List Server option for internal and external publishing of information (e.g., report subscriptions).
The system shall allow agency administrators to integrate directory services with complimentary external systems for a unified client experience.
The system shall provide RSS Feeds managed by agency administrators.
